task_list.name: Stardist Segmentation
task_list.docs_info:
### Purpose
- **Segments images using Stardist models**.
- Supports both **built-in Stardist models** (shipped with Stardist) and **user-trained models**.
- Accepts single channel image input for segmentation.
- Can process **arbitrary regions of interest (ROIs)**, including whole images, fields of view (FOVs), or masked outputs from prior segmentations, based on corresponding ROI tables.
- Provides access to all advanced Stardist parameters.

### Outputs
- Generates a new label image named `<channel_identifier>_segmented` if no label name is provided.

normalization.title: Normalization
normalization.description: Normalization parameters. The normalization is applied before running the Stardist model for each channel independently.

sparse.title: Sparse
sparse.description: If true, aggregate probabilities/distances sparsely during tiled prediction to save memory (recommended)

prob_thresh.title: Prob Thresh
prob_thresh.description: Consider only object candidates from pixels with predicted object probability above this threshold.

nms_thresh.title: Nms Thresh
nms_thresh.description: Perform non-maximum suppression (NMS) that considers two objects to be the same when their area/surface overlap exceeds this threshold.

scale.title: Scale
scale.description: Scale the input image internally by a tuple of floats and rescale the output accordingly. Useful if the Stardist model has been trained on images with different scaling. E.g. (z, y, x) = (1.0, 0.5, 0.5).

n_tiles.title: N Tiles
n_tiles.description: Out of memory (OOM) errors can occur if the input image is too large. To avoid this problem, the input image is broken up into (overlapping) tiles that are processed independently and re-assembled. This parameter denotes a tuple of the number of tiles for every image axis. E.g. (z, y, x) = (2, 4, 4).

show_tile_progress.title: Show Tile Progress
show_tile_progress.description: Whether to show progress during tiled prediction.

verbose.title: Verbose
verbose.description: Whether to print some info messages.

predict_kwargs.title: Predict Kwargs
predict_kwargs.description: Keyword arguments for ``predict`` function of Keras model.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Literal["Create Masking ROI Table"]: Mode to create masking ROI table.

table_name.title: Table Name
table_name.description: str: Name of the masking ROI table to be created. Defaults to "{label_name}_masking_ROI_table", where {label_name} is the name of the label image used for segmentation.

sigma_xy.title: Sigma Xy
sigma_xy.description: Standard deviation for Gaussian kernel in XY plane.

sigma_z.title: Sigma Z
sigma_z.description: Standard deviation for Gaussian kernel in Z axis. If not specified, no smoothing is applied in Z axis.

masking.title: Masking Iterator Configuration
masking.description: If configured, the segmentation will be only saved within the mask region.

roi_table.title: Iterate Over ROIs
roi_table.description: Name of a ROI table. If provided, the segmentation will be performed for each ROI in the specified ROI table.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Mode of masking to be applied. If "Table Name", the identifier refers to a masking table name. If "Label Name", the identifier refers to a label image name.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Name of the masking table or label image depending on the mode.

size_xy.title: Size Xy
size_xy.description: Size in pixels of the median filter in XY plane.

size_z.title: Size Z
size_z.description: Size in pixels of the median filter in Z axis. If not specified, no filtering is applied in Z axis.

NormalizationParameters.description: Validator to handle different normalization scenarios for Stardist models

norm_type.title: Norm Type
norm_type.description: One of `default` (Stardist default normalization), `custom` (using the other custom parameters) or `no_normalization`.

lower_percentile.title: Lower Percentile
lower_percentile.description: Specify a custom lower-bound percentile for rescaling as a float value between 0 and 100. Set to 1 to run the same as default). You can only specify percentiles or bounds, not both.

upper_percentile.title: Upper Percentile
upper_percentile.description: Specify a custom upper-bound percentile for rescaling as a float value between 0 and 100. Set to 99 to run the same as default, set to e.g. 99.99 if the default rescaling was too harsh. You can only specify percentiles or bounds, not both.

lower_bound.title: Lower Bound
lower_bound.description: Explicit lower bound value to rescale the image at. Needs to be an integer, e.g. 100. You can only specify percentiles or bounds, not both.

upper_bound.title: Upper Bound
upper_bound.description: Explicit upper bound value to rescale the image at. Needs to be an integer, e.g. 2000. You can only specify percentiles or bounds, not both.

NormalizationParameters.title: NormalizationParameters

PrePostProcessConfiguration.description: Configuration for pre- and post-processing steps.
PrePostProcessConfiguration.title: PrePostProcessConfiguration

min_size.title: Min Size
min_size.description: Minimum size in pixels for objects to keep.

SkipCreateMaskingRoiTable.description: Skip Creating Masking ROI Table Configuration

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Literal["Skip Creating Masking ROI Table"]: Mode to skip creating masking ROI table

SkipCreateMaskingRoiTable.title: SkipCreateMaskingRoiTable

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Specifies how to interpret the identifier. Can be "label", "wavelength_id", or "index" (must be an integer). At least one and at most three identifiers must be provided.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: Unique identifier for the channel. This can be a channel label, wavelength ID, or index.

StardistpretrainedModel.description: Parameters to load a custom pretrained model

base_fld.title: Base Fld
base_fld.description: Base folder to where custom Stardist models are stored

StardistpretrainedModel.title: StardistpretrainedModel

label_name.title: Label Name
label_name.description: Name of the resulting label image. If not provided, it will be set to "<channel_identifier>_segmented".

level_path.title: Level Path
level_path.description: If the OME-Zarr has multiple resolution levels, the level to use can be specified here. If not provided, the highest resolution level will be used.

iterator_configuration.title: Iterator Configuration
iterator_configuration.description: Configuration for the segmentation iterator. This can be used to specify masking and/or a ROI table.

model_type.title: Model Type
model_type.description: Parameter of `Stardist_ModelNames` class. Defines which model should be used. E.g. `2D_versatile_fluo`, `2D_versatile_he`, `2D_demo`, `3D_demo`.

custom_model.title: Custom Model
custom_model.description: Allows you to specify the path of a custom trained stardist model (takes precedence over `model_type`).

pre_post_process.title: Pre Post Process
pre_post_process.description: Configuration for pre- and post-processing steps.

create_masking_roi_table.title: Create Masking Roi Table
create_masking_roi_table.description: Configuration to create a masking ROI table after segmentation.

overwrite.title: Overwrite
overwrite.description: Whether to overwrite an existing label image. Defaults to True.

task_list.name: Seeded Watershed Segmentation
task_list.docs_info:
### Purpose
- **Seeded Segmentation to retrieve e.g. Cell Segmentation**.
- Accepts label_name of label image to use as seeds (e.g. nuclei) and single channel image input that contains boundary (e.g. membrane) marker.
- Can process **arbitrary regions of interest (ROIs)**, including whole images, fields of view (FOVs), or masked outputs from prior segmentations, based on corresponding ROI tables.
- If masked segmentation should be performed, use ROI table of type masking_roi_table.

### Limitations
- This task assumes that label_name and channel image are in same zarr_url.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: Unique identifier for the channel. This can be a channel label, wavelength ID, or index.

compactness.title: Compactness
compactness.description: Parameter for skimage.segmentation.watershed. Higher values result in more regularly-shaped watershed basins.

min_size.title: Min Size

ref_acquisition.title: Ref Acquisition
ref_acquisition.description: If provided the task will not cause an error if the label does not exist for non-reference acquisitions.

label_name.title: Label Name
label_name.description: Name of the seed label image to use for segmentation e.g. "nuclei".

channels.title: Channels
channels.description: Channels to use for segmentation. It must contain between 1 and 3 channel identifiers.

output_label_name.title: Output Label Name
output_label_name.description: Name of the resulting label image. If not provided, it will be set to "<channel_identifier>_segmented".

level_path.title: Level Path
level_path.description: If the OME-Zarr has multiple resolution levels, the level to use can be specified here. If not provided, the highest resolution level will be used.

iterator_configuration.title: Iterator Configuration
iterator_configuration.description: Configuration for the segmentation iterator. This can be used to specify masking and/or a ROI table.

pre_post_process.description: Configuration for pre- and post-processing steps.

create_masking_roi_table.description: Configuration to create a masking ROI table after segmentation.

overwrite.title: Overwrite
overwrite.description: Whether to overwrite an existing label image. Defaults to True.
